saying: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door
meaning: One should not passively wait for opportunities to arise, but rather actively create them. It encourages taking initiative and being proactive in pursuing one's goals. This can involve developing skills, networking, and taking calculated risks. Ultimately, it's about taking control of one's destiny and not relying solely on chance.

definition: an example or pattern; esp an outstandingly clear or typical example

a subgenre of science fiction in a dystopian futuristic setting said to focus on a combination of "low-life and high tech"; it features futuristic technological and scientific achievements, such as artificial intelligence and cyberware, juxtaposed with societal collapse, dystopia or decay
a hypothetical construction – usually a weapon or weapons system – which could destroy all life on a planet, particularly Earth, or destroy the planet itself
notes: Most hypothetical constructions rely on hydrogen bombs being made arbitrarily large, assuming there are no concerns about delivering them to a target (see Teller–Ulam design) or that they can be "salted" with materials designed to create long-lasting and hazardous fallout (e.g., a cobalt bomb)

definition: our tendency to cast people and groups in irreconcilable terms

instances: Spain has more on the order of 100,000 laws
black-and-white newspapers (color ink is toxic to plants)

name: Silent Spring
author: Rachel Carson
topic: the extent of environmental damage caused by insecticides

definition: a system of methods used in a particular area of study or activity
an artistic and social movement that originated in Italy, and to a lesser extent in other countries, in the early 20th century
values: objects such as the car, the airplane, and the industrial city
notes: Many Italian Futurists supported Fascism in the hope of modernizing a country divided between the industrialising north and the rural, archaic South.
Like the Fascists, the Futurists were Italian nationalists, laborers, disgruntled war veterans, radicals, admirers of violence, and opposed to parliamentary democracy

definition: ten thousand hours is the average number of hours across disciplines that research shows it takes to become an expert
notes: based on research by Anders Ericsson
popularized in Malcolm Gladwell’s book Outliers

definition: a concept that views the universe, including human beings, as systems processing data; it assumes that the value of everything is determined by its contribution to data processing; it sees data as the fundamental organizing principle of reality, with information flows as the primary driver of progress and understanding
notes: it originates in the emerging significance of big data

the term has been expanded to describe what historian Yuval Noah Harari, in his book Homo Deus: A Brief History of Tomorrow from 2015, calls an emerging ideology or even a new form of religion, in which "information flow" is the "supreme value"

definition: the widespread collection and commodification of personal data by corporations
notes: surveillance capitalism is considered distinct from government surveillance, although the two can be mutually reinforcing

definition: the study of cyclic and seasonal natural phenomena, especially in relation to climate and plant and animal life

a philosophical and intellectual movement that advocates the enhancement of the human condition by developing and making widely available new and future technologies that can greatly enhance longevity, cognition, and well-being
the production of an analysis that corresponds too closely or exactly to a particular set of data, and may therefore fail to fit to additional data or predict future observations reliably
something that you do, or a thing that you give someone, that expresses your feelings or intentions, although it might have little practical effect
instances: As a token of our gratitude for all that you have done, we would like you to accept this small gift.

description: soft bodied, pear-shaped insects that suck/feed on plant sap
notes: aphids are a familiar garden pest and seldom cause major damage
aphids are also a favorite food source of ladybugs, lacewings, and other beneficial insects

title: El Reino de Dios es como un grano de mostaza
content: many grain legumes are deficient in the sulfur-containing amino acids cystine and methionine

title: El Reino de Dios es como un grano de mostaza
discussion: Muchas cosas grandes empiezan siendo pequeñas
A menudo nos cuesta apreciar la grandeza y consecuencias de algo simple
related-to: kill a revolution in the bud
El Principito obsesionado con arrancar baobabs incipientes

topic: ataques con drones a Rusia en E. de Siberia

definition: consist of two protons and two neutrons bound together into a particle identical to a helium-4 nucleus
a high-energy, high-speed electron or positron emitted by the radioactive decay of an atomic nucleus, known as beta decay
notes: There are two forms of beta decay, β− decay and β+ decay, which produce electrons and positrons, respectively

definition: consists of the shortest wavelength electromagnetic waves, typically shorter than those of X-rays
origin: high energy interactions like the radioactive decay of atomic nuclei
energy: from a few kiloelectronvolts (keV) to approximately 8 megaelectronvolts (MeV), corresponding to the typical energy levels in nuclei with reasonably long lifetimes
notes: The energy ranges of gamma rays and X-rays overlap in the electromagnetic spectrum, so the terminology for these electromagnetic waves varies between scientific disciplines

Gamma rays are ionizing radiation and are thus hazardous to life. They can cause DNA mutations, cancer and tumors, and at high doses burns and radiation sickness. Due to their high penetration power, they can damage bone marrow and internal organs. Unlike alpha and beta rays, they easily pass through the body and thus pose a formidable radiation protection challenge, requiring shielding made from dense materials such as lead or concrete. On Earth, the magnetosphere protects life from most types of lethal cosmic radiation other than gamma rays.

definition: En la ética aplicada, la casuística se refiere al razonamiento basado en casos. Se utiliza en cuestiones éticas y jurídicas, y a menudo representa una crítica del razonamiento basado en principios o reglas. La casuística es utilizar la razón para resolver problemas morales aplicando reglas teóricas a instancias específicas.
releasing their seeds by splitting open along two seams

name: Core Principles in a Field
author: John Reed
content: When you first study a field, it seems like you have to memorize a zillion things. You don’t. What you need is to identify the three-to-five core principles that govern the field. The million things you thought you had to memorize are various combinations of the core principles.

definition: a numerical or other measurable factor forming one of a set that defines a system or sets the conditions of its operation
an element of a system that is useful, or critical, when identifying the system, or when evaluating its performance, status, condition, etc.

a characteristic that defines or classifies a system, often used to set limits or conditions; it can be a variable in a mathematical equation or a fixed value that influences how something is done or performed.
notes: In statistics, parameters are characteristics of an entire population, such as the average age of teachers in the United States

definition: a milky fermented liquid, largely made from Agave salmiana, Agave mapisaga, and Agave americana sap, which has an herbal aroma, low alcohol content (4–6%), and high acidity (pH = 3.5–4.2)
notes: its origins date back to the Early Classic period (AD 150–650), was used in religious rituals to honor the Aztec goddess, Mayahuel, and was regularly consumed by Aztec nobility

definition: the sense of control that you feel in your life, your capacity to influence your own thoughts and behavior, and have faith in your ability to handle a wide range of tasks and situations. Your sense of agency helps you to be psychologically stable, yet flexible in the face of conflict or change
a voting system that encourages voters to express their true relative intensity of preference between multiple options or elections
explanation: Quadratic voting works by having voters allocate "credits" (which are either real currencies or artificially distributed tokens) to various issues. The number of votes to add is determined by a quadratic cost function, meaning that to vote n times for a given option, n^2 credits are required to be allocated (for example, 3 votes would cost 9 credits). Because the quadratic cost function makes each additional vote more expensive, voters are incentivized to allocate their credits to reflect their true relative preferences between different options, as opposed to previous proposals for storable votes where voters may choose to allocate all their votes to a single cause and not accurately represent their true preferences.
discussion: By doing so, quadratic voting seeks to mitigate tyranny of the majority by enabling participants to trade influence over issues they don't care about for influence over issues they do.

definition: a reaction that requires energy to be driven
notes: Endergonic means "absorbing energy in the form of work".
The activation energy for the reaction is typically larger than the overall energy of the exergonic reaction (1). Endergonic reactions are nonspontaneous.

author: Neal Stephenson
content: Where serious and competent people need to get things done in the real world, all considerations of tradition and protocol fly out of the window.

author: Neal Stephenson
content: The only thing that can effect a change in personality is something that physically rewires the brain and/or alters the body's chemical milieu.

author: Neal Stephenson
content: The future is there, looking back at us, trying to make sense of the fiction we will have become.

author: Neal Stephenson
content: Any property that is open to common use gets destroyed. Because everyone has incentive to use it to the max, but no one has incentive to maintain.

author: Neal Stephenson
content: Well, all information looks like noise until you break the code.

name: catarsis
definition: f. Purificación, liberación o transformación interior suscitadas por una experiencia vital profunda.

name: ecología profunda
definition: La ecología profunda es una rama de la filosofía ecológica que considera a la humanidad parte de su entorno, proponiendo cambios culturales, políticos, sociales y económicos para lograr una convivencia armónica entre los seres humanos y el resto de los seres vivos.

name: ecología profunda
author: Arne Naess
content: la ecología profunda o de amplio alcance (deep, long-range ecology) se distingue de la ecología superficial o de corto alcance (shallow, short-range ecology) en un cuestionamiento más hondo de las causas y fundamentos de la crisis ecológica. Partiendo del reconocimiento del valor inherente de la diversidad ecológica y cultural de todos los seres vivos, su enfoque no se limita a aquello que pone en peligro el bienestar o la supervivencia de la especie humana. La ecología profunda declara la interdependencia fundamental entre todos los fenómenos y el hecho de que, como individuos y como sociedades, estamos inmersos en (y finalmente dependientes de) los procesos cíclicos de la naturaleza.

title: Ecología profunda controvertida
content: Las posiciones defendidas por la ecología profunda han sido objeto de tantas controversias y críticas que merece la pena indagar en las razones que indujeron, por ejemplo, al cineasta y ecologista de moda, Al Gore, a calificarla como una filosofía “intrínsecamente misántropa” en la que el ser humano es “un alien en la Tierra” [1], o al intelectual francés Luc Ferry a concluir que “se puede decir legítimamente que la ecología profunda hunde algunas de sus raíces en el nazismo y alza sus ramas hasta las esferas más extremas del izquierdismo cultural” [2]. Y observamos que, en casi todos los casos, el pretendido radicalismo de la ecología profunda estriba en su crítica del antropocentrismo y de aquellos fundamentos culturales de Occidente que han abocado al mundo a la crisis multidimensional que enfrenta desde hace tiempo.

name: convergent evolution
definition: the independent development of the same characteristic in unrelated taxa

name: butoh significa bailar con sombras
content: Todo el mundo tiene sombra. Todo el mundo puede bailar butoh. Coger sombras. Cuantas más sombras.
